data.meta_description: Eventbrite - Barnes & Noble - Northgate (Seattle, WA) presents Amie Kaufman celebrates THE HEART OF THE WORLD at B&N Northgate - Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at Barnes & Noble, Seattle, WA. Find event and ticket information.
data.text:
Join Barnes & Noble Northgate in Seattle, WA on Tuesday, September 17, 2024, at 5:30PM PT as we welcome New York Times bestselling author Amie Kaufman in celebration of her newest book THE HEART OF THE WORLD. Magic and sacrifice will collide as lovers and gods, enemies and allies vie for the fate of the world in this heart-pounding sequel to THE ISLES OF THE GODS. Amie will be in conversation with #1 New York Times bestselling author Kendare Blake.

_____________________________________________________________________________________________

To make this event safe and enjoyable for all attendees, please read the below guidelines ahead of buying a ticket, so you know what to expect on the day. To avoid disappointment, we must stress that there will be no access to the event for non-ticketholders.

Barnes & Noble reserves the right to make new rules and orders in its sole discretion with regard to COVID-19 at any time and any person not abiding by the Barnes & Noble directives will be refused entrance or directed to leave the premises.

TICKET INFORMATION

There is a limit of one ticket per customer. Please choose one ticket type below.

THE HEART OF THE WORLD Discussion + Signing Admission - $22.06 (Admission + one signed copy of THE HEART OF THE WORLD) **LIMITED QUANTITY AVAILABLE**: A ticket PER PERSON includes:

One signed hardcover copy of THE HEART OF THE WORLD (9/17/24).

Admission to the discussion and signing with Amie Kaufman and Kendare Blake.

THE ISLES OF THE GODS Discussion + Signing Admission - $22.06 (Admission + one signed copy of THE ISLE OF THE GODS) **LIMITED QUANTITY AVAILABLE**: A ticket PER PERSON includes:

One signed hardcover copy of THE ISLES OF THE GODS.

Admission to the discussion and signing with Amie Kaufman and Kendare Blake.

DISCUSSION ONLY Admission - FREE ***LIMITED QUANTITY AVAILABLE***: A ticket PER PERSON includes:

Admission to the discussion with Amie Kaufman and Kendare Blake.

This ticket does NOT admit you to the signing following the discussion. If you wish to participate in the signing to meet the authors, take photos, and get books signed, you MUST purchase one of the ticket options above.

--> All seating is limited on a first come, first served basis, and standing room will be provided. Purchase of a ticket guarantees entrance to the event for the discussion. However, this ticket may not necessarily guarantee a seat at the event, as later arrivals may be placed in standing room behind the seated audience. If you require assistance, please let us know. We are happy to accommodate you!

GUIDELINES

Attendees may bring books from home to get signed and personalized. There is no limit at this time. The authors' backlists will be available for purchase at the event.

Photos may be taken with the authors from in front of the signing table. A bookseller will be on-hand to assist.

Ticket holders will be admitted into the event space beginning at 4:30PM the day of the event. Check-in will be closed before this time and seating may not be reserved until then. Please have a copy of your ticket available (either printed out or on your phone) for check-in.

Due to health and safety and space limitations, those without a ticket will not be permitted into the event space.

No memorabilia will be signed at the event.

No large bags will be permitted into the event.

The exact time at which the event ends will be determined on the day. To avoid disappointment, we strongly advise you to arrive on time for the event. Late arrivals may not have the opportunity to meet the author.

All event guidelines are subject to change.

If you have any additional questions, please can call the store directly at: (206) 417-2967

Barnes & Noble may cancel this event at any time with or without notice to the ticket holders.

Please note that Eventbrite is the only authorized dealer for this event. Each person must have a ticket to enter.

REFUNDS

Attendees can receive refunds up to 1 day (24 hours) before your event start TIME of 5:30 PM.

If you are unable to attend the event, Barnes & Noble - Northgate (Seattle, WA) will hold your books for seven days after the event. Please contact the store to arrange your pickup.

Should this event be canceled due to changing COVID-19 concerns, all customers will be refunded their ticket price to the original method of payment per Eventbrite's refund policy.

Event guidelines are subject to change.

_____________________________________________________________________________________________

ABOUT THE HEART OF THE WORLD

When Selly and Leander began their treacherous voyage to the Isles of the Gods, the captain’s daughter and the playboy prince were strangers. But amid talk of war and a deadly attack on their ship, the unthinkable happened.

They fell in love.

Leander’s ritual at the island temple was meant to prevent a war between the gods. Instead, it nearly cost him his life, and drew the goddess Barrica back from exile. Now, as her Messenger, Leander is imbued with her deadly magic, and only Selly’s presence can stop it from consuming him.

But Barrica wasn’t the only immortal roused from sleep. The God of Risk, Macean, was awakened by an enemy all thought dead, and across the sea he’s calling for war.

The fight to save their world will take Selly and Leander from the gilded ballroom of the royal palace to the hallowed halls of an ancient library. Battle lines will be drawn, and bonds will break.

With the wrath of gods and the machinations of power-hungry rulers straining their loyalties, can their love withstand the trials that await them?

ABOUT THE ISLES OF THE GODS

Magic, romance, and slumbering gods clash in this riveting romantasy about a seafaring girl and a playboy prince who band together in a precarious journey. From theNew York Timesbestselling author of the Aurora Cycle and the Illuminae Files.

Selly has salt water in her veins. So when her father leaves her high and dry in the port of Kirkpool, she has no intention of riding out the winter at home while he sails off to adventure. But any plans to follow him are dashed when a handsome stranger with tell-tale magician's marks on his arm commandeers her ship. He is Prince Leander of Alinor and he needs to cross the Crescent Sea without detection so he can complete a ritual on the sacred Isles of the Gods. Selly has no desire to escort a spoiled prince anywhere, and no time for his entitled demands or his good looks. But what starts as a leisure cruise will lead to acts of treason and sheer terror on the high seas, bringing two countries to the brink of war, two strangers closer than they ever thought possible and stirring two dangerous gods from centuries of slumber...

ABOUT AMIE KAUFMAN

Amie Kaufman is the New York Times bestselling co-author of the Illuminae Files and the Aurora Cycle, with Jay Kristoff, and the Starbound, Unearthed, and Other Side of the Sky series with Meagan Spooner. Raised in Australia and occasionally Ireland, Amie has degrees in history, literature, law and conflict resolution, and is currently undertaking a PhD in Creative Writing. She lives in Melbourne with her husband, daughter and rescue dog, and an extremely large personal library.You can learn more about Amie at amiekaufman.com, on social, or via her podcast.

ABOUT KENDARE BLAKE
